Cell.Data: TASK
Link
Additional explanation
Create a checklist for the [learn.epam.com] application.
1-2q_Checklist
Please see the list.
Point out which tests you think should be added to the regression scope and smoke scope.
1-2q_Checklist

Please see the list.
1. Smoke scope. It consists of a minimal set of tests run on each build to test software functionalities. It is a simple test that shows the product is ready for testing.
2. Regression scope Usually, to conduct regression testing a tester should select test cases that will cover areas that can be influenced by new changes. So, these testing scenarios are not scripted and depend on the situation. As these are repetitive tests, test cases can be automated so that a set of test cases alone can be easily executed on a new build. Regression test cases need to be selected very carefully so that maximum functionality is covered in a minimum set of test cases. These set of test cases need continuous improvements for newly added functionality. It is appropriate to have a regression test suite at every level of testing (component testing, integration testing, system testing, etc.).
Various techniques for selecting: - Retest all - the entire test cases in the test suite are re-executed. This is an expensive method as it requires more time and resources when compared to the other techniques. - Regression Test Selection - In this method, test cases are selected from the test suite to be re-executed. Not that the entire suite has been re-executed. The selection of test cases is done on the basis of code change in the module. - Test case Prioritization. Test cases with high Priority are executed first rather than the ones with medium and low priority. The priority of the test case depends on its criticality and its impact on the product and also on the functionality of the product which is used more often. - Hybrid - The hybrid technique is a combination of Regression Test Selection and Test case Prioritization.
Create test cases for smoke testing.
3q_Test_cases_Smoke
Please see the list.
Compare checklist and test cases and explain what is more reasonable to use and why.

I. Checklists for Functionality of learn.epam.com (on March 2023)
Start page
Verify
The Main Menu works correctly.

Сore functionality or features of the App. But the probability of an error as a result of changing other functionality is relatively low. Regression testing is possible if the changes could affect on this functionality.
All buttons and links on the Start page work correctly.

The "Log in to get full experience" and "Log in" buttons on the Start page present and work correctly. When the user clicks on them, users should be redirected to the EPAM Digital Platform (https://access.epam.com/auth/....) for registration or login.
Smoke testing
Smoke testing as main, minimal mission-critical functionality, before planned testing begins. Regression testing is possible if the changes could affect on this functionality.

Сore functionality or features of the App. But the probability of an error as a result of changing other functionality is relatively low. Regression testing is possible if the changes could affect on this functionality.

The "Progress bar" widget on the Start page works correctly. Progress bar shows the user's course progress status in a friendly way. If the user have several courses that was started them will see two most completed courses on the start page.
Non-priority test cases for regression testing.
The 'Back' icon/arrow appears, when the user scrolls down the page.
The footer 'Privacy Policy, Privacy Notice, Cookies Policy' appears, when the user reaches the end of the page, and all links work.
Important functionality, but the probability of an error there is relatively small.
User Profile
Verify
When the user wants to update the information in the profile, clicking on the "edit" icon in the user's profile redirects them to the EPAM/PROFILE platform: https://profile.epam.com / (user id).

Important functionality or features of the App. But the probability of an error as a result of changing other functionality is relatively low. Regression testing is possible if the changes could affect on this functionality.
After saving changes in the user's profile on the EPAM/PROFILE platform, the changed information is reflected in the user profile.
The user can sign out of the application.
Smoke testing
Smoke testing as main, minimal mission-critical functionality, before planned testing begins. Regression testing is possible if the changes could affect on this functionality.
The user can select, save and change their location using the "Location" widget. "Location" widget is displayed only after login.
Non-priority test cases for regression testing.
The working of the "BOOKMARKS" widget in "My profile" is correct.
Intersects with this widget check in the "Catalog" section.
"Catalog" section
Verify
The working of the "All item" widget is correct.
Regression testing
Core functionality or features of the App. Priority test cases.
The ability to add courses to bookmarks.

Important functionality or features of the App. But the probability of an error as a result of changing other functionality is relatively low. Regression testing is possible if the changes could affect on this functionality.
The working of the "BOOKMARKS" widget is correct.
Regression testing
Core functionality or features of the App. Priority test cases.
The possibility to search for courses in the search field.

Important functionality or features of the App. But the probability of an error as a result of changing other functionality is relatively low. Regression testing is possible if the changes could affect on this functionality.
The working of the "SСHEDULE" widget is correct. "SCHEDULE" is a list of learning courses with fixed dates in calendar order or already planned ongoing courses.
The user can sort content with button box "Sort by" section by rating, enrolled, name.
Regression testing
Functionalities that are frequently used. Priority test cases.
The user can filter content in the "FILTERS" subsection.
Regression testing
Course Content
Verify
The user can open Base Details Page of course by clicking on the card of this course.

Important functionality or features of the App. But the probability of an error as a result of changing other functionality is relatively low. Regression testing is possible if the changes could affect on this functionality.
The possibility to review catalog and courses description without logging in.

The user can log in to the application by clicking on any of two "Log in to study" buttons on the course page (for courses that does not requires registration). When the user clicking on any of them, the user should be redirected to the EPAM Digital Platform (https://access.epam.com/auth/....) for registration or log in.
Smoke testing
Smoke testing as main, minimal mission-critical functionality, before planned testing begins. Regression testing is possible if the changes could affect on this functionality.

The user can log in to the application by clicking on any of two "Log in to register" buttons on the course page (for courses that requires registration). When the user clicking on any of them, the user should be redirected to the EPAM Digital Platform (https://access.epam.com/auth/....) for registration or log in.
Smoke testing
Clicking on the "Register" button opens the registration widget.
Smoke testing
The working of registration widget is correct.
Regression testing
Functionalities that are frequently used. Priority test cases.
The possibility to receive a notification when the course dates are established, if the user submitted a request for education.
Regression testing
Correct working of "Study" button. This button redirects to the platform eLearn.EPAM.com (https://elearn.epam.com) to a specific course.
Smoke testing
Smoke testing as main, minimal mission-critical functionality, before planned testing begins. Regression testing is possible if the changes could affect the functionality of the button.
After the end of the course, the user can view its materials using the clicking "View" button, that should appear automatically after course completion.
Regression testing
Functionalities that are frequently used. Priority test cases.
Feedbacks
Verify

The possibility to leave a feedback after the end of the course using Feedback widget. Correct working of this widget. After completing a training course, the user can go to "MY LEARNING" and click "LEAVE FEEDBACK" button the next to the course they have completed.

Non-priority test cases for regression testing. The probability of an error as a result of changing other functionality is relatively low. Regression testing is possible if the changes could affect on this functionality.
Automatic sending of a feedback request to the user's email after the end of the course.
The letter with the request for feedback is formed correctly.
"My learning" section
Verify
The progress of the user's training activities is saved and displayed correctly.
Regression testing
Core functionality or features of the App. Priority test cases.
The user can sort content in this section by Creation Date, Course Name, Status, Start Date, Update Date.
Regression testing
Functionalities that are frequently used. Priority test cases.
The user can filter content by start date, created on.
Regression testing
The working of the "All Requests" widget is correct.
Regression testing
Core functionality or features of the App. Priority test cases.
The working of the "Feedback Required" widget is correct.
Regression testing
The working of the "Active Requests" widget is correct.
Regression testing
The working of the "Closed Requests" widget is correct.
Regression testing
The user can manage their courses using courses widgets in "My learning" section is correct. The buttons "Study", "Exclude me", "Leave Feedback" are displayed and working correctly.
Regression testing
"Contribution" section
Verify
The working of the "Mentorship" widget is correct.
Regression testing
Functionalities that are frequently used. Priority test cases.
The working of the "Expert view" widget is correct.
Regression testing
The user can filter content in this section by start date, created on.
Non-priority test cases for regression testing.
The user can sort content in this section by Course Name, Creation Date, Update Date, Status.
"Help" section
Verify
The "Next" button redirects to the next page.
Non-priority test cases for regression testing.
The "Previous" button redirects to the previous page.
The user can navigate in this section using the content widget.
Technical Support ( icon "Help & Support" widget)
Verify
Clicking on the question icon opens the "Help & Support" widget.

Non-priority test cases for regression testing. The probability of an error as a result of changing other functionality is relatively low. Regression testing is possible if the changes could affect on this functionality.
The user can enter up to 2000 symbols inclusive in the widget text input field. Check valid and invalid characters.
The ability to attach a file to the message via "Help & Support" widget. Check the format and size limits.
The button "Send" the message works correctly.
II. Checklists for Non-Functional Testing of learn.epam.com (on March 2023)
GUI Testing
Verify
A font, text color, and color coding of the pages is as per the standard.
Non-priority test cases for regression testing.
All buttons, links and widgets are displayed as per the standard.
The correctness of the display of the course card and its elements.
Compatibility testing
Verify
The possibility to load the application on multiple browsers, operating systems, and devices.
Regression testing
Priority test cases.
The application is compatible with multiple browsers, operating systems, and devices. The application works in the same way for all platforms.
Regression testing
Interoperability testing
Verify
The application interacts correctly with platform EPAM Digital Platform (https://access.epam.com).
Regression testing
Integration test cases that include all the major components. Priority test cases
The application interacts correctly with platform https://profile.epam.com.
Regression testing
The application interacts correctly with platform eLearn.EPAM.com.
Regression testing
The application interacts correctly with platforms from "Public App" widget.
Regression testing
Security testing
Verify
User data is protected.
Priority test cases. Complex Test Cases.
The impossibility to access other users' personal information.
The system is protected from third-party attacks.
The timeout functionality of the login session.
If the user pressed "Back button" of the browser, it should not allow to enter into the system once the user log out.
Non-priority test cases for regression testing.
Usability testing
Verify
Users can use the application easy, convenient, and effective. Note that usability testing is not implemented as a separate type but can be used in addition to GUI testing.
Non-priority test cases for regression testing.
The information in "Help" section is up-to-date.
Performance Testing
Verify
The possibility of loading the application within a specified amount of time.
Regression testing
Priority test cases. Complex Test Cases.
The speed, responsiveness, efficiency, and stability of application under a workload. How application behaves when it is being used and how fast it works under various loads.
Regression testing
Accessibility testing
Verify

The website and content pages meet the accessibility standards established by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C), particularly the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0 Level A/AA, and the additional elements proposed by W3C in its WCAG 2.1
Non-priority test cases for regression testing.
Maintainability testing
Verify
The software's capability to be modified without introducing defects or compromising existing functionality.
Non-priority test cases for regression testing.
Additionally
Smoke scope
It consists of a minimal set of tests run on each build to test software functionalities. It is a simple test that shows the product is ready for testing.
It can also be included in Regression testing

- Test cases that cover the module where the changes have been made. - Priority 1 and Priority 2 test cases should be included. - Test cases of frequently failed or recent testing defects were found for the same. - Complex test cases. - Integration Test Cases
